prompt: Explain how a mechanical engineer approaches the problem of analyzing stress in a loaded beam. Discuss how the problem is defined, the assumptions made, equations used, calculation techniques, and how the results are communicated through diagrams and reports.

criteria.name: Problem Definition and Assumptions
criteria.description: Clearly defines the engineering problem and outlines the assumptions made in analysis.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Provides a thorough definition of the problem and clearly explains relevant assumptions.
performance_descriptors.good: Defines the problem and includes most key assumptions.
performance_descriptors.average: Gives a basic outline of the problem with some assumptions.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Unclear or incomplete problem definition and missing assumptions.
performance_descriptors.poor: Fails to define the problem or identify any assumptions.

criteria.name: Application of Mechanics and Equations
criteria.description: Applies correct stress and strain formulas relevant to beam analysis.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Accurately applies equations with clear justification and step-by-step use.
performance_descriptors.good: Uses relevant formulas with minor errors or incomplete explanations.
performance_descriptors.average: Applies formulas at a basic level with limited explanation.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Incorrect or vague use of mechanical equations.
performance_descriptors.poor: Does not apply correct formulas or omits them entirely.

criteria.name: Interpretation of Results
criteria.description: Presents results with diagrams and explains their significance.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Provides labeled diagrams and insightful explanation of outcomes.
performance_descriptors.good: Includes diagrams and explains results adequately.
performance_descriptors.average: Some diagrams or results provided with limited explanation.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Diagrams unclear or explanation lacks relevance.
performance_descriptors.poor: No diagrams or interpretation of results.

criteria.name: Structure and Technical Writing
criteria.description: Essay is well-organized and written in formal engineering style.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Highly structured with precise technical language throughout.
performance_descriptors.average: Structure present but writing inconsistently formal.

key_points: Defines the problem by identifying beam type, supports, and loading conditions.
Lists key assumptions like linear material behavior and small deformations.
Uses stress formulas such as Ïƒ = My/I and shear stress equations appropriately.
Employs free-body diagrams and shear/moment diagrams in the solution process.
Presents results using labeled diagrams and discusses critical stress locations.
Follows formal technical writing style suitable for engineering reports.
llm_questions: How is the problem of stress in beams typically defined in engineering practice?
What assumptions are made in beam stress analysis?
What is the bending stress equation used in beam analysis?
How are shear force and bending moment diagrams used in reports?
How does one determine maximum stress points in a beam?
